chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alec D Atkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days; alternate 4 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Alec D Atkins did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court orders the following:
$267.500 to be paid within 90 days or 4 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
